results.title: The Apartment
results.brief_description: This classic romantic comedy gave Jack Lemmon one of his best roles. Lemmon was ideally cast as an ambitious clerk in a big insurance company trying to gain promotion by renting out his apartment to senior executives for their extra-marital trysts. Everything goes according to plan until Lemmon falls in love with elevator operator Shirley Maclaine - and discovers that she is the mistress of his boss Fred MacMurray. The three central performances were perfect and Lemmon and Maclaine both received well deserved Oscar nominations. This multi-award winning movie is one to be seen again and again.

results.title: The Apache Indian
results.brief_description: Illustrates how the ancient Apache ceremonies have undergone little change through the years, still providing opportunities for tribal pageantry and displays such as horsemanship. Includes the ‘puberty’ ceremonial dance of a young girl involving the whole community.

results.title: The Anzac Story
results.creator_credit: George I. Malcolm, Frank Hunter and ABC
results.brief_description: This video contains two programs pertaining to the history of the Anzacs using archival footage, drawings and stills and narrated by Barry Lineham. “Prelude to glory” - Presents a brief historical overview of Captain Cook’s landings in New Zealand and Australia and the following events which took place including colonisation, the chain of British governors, a Treaty with the Maoris, Federation in Australia, and the eventual lead up to World War I. With the advent of the War came the formation of the Anzac Corps, an alliance between the Australian and New Zealand defence forces, and a commitment by the Anzacs to fight for the British Empire in a war half a world away. Shows the sailing of the first convoy, the naval battle and sinking of the German battle ship “Emden” and the arrival of the Anzacs in Egypt. “Gallipoli” - Tells the story of this ill-fated war against the Turks, the tragic mistakes, the chaos and disorganisation, and the horrendous loss of young Anzacs (10,000 soldiers) from the botched up landing on 25 April 1915 in a small bay south of Ari Burnu (renamed Anzac Cove) to the eventual evacuation of all troops in December 1915.

results.title: The Antique collector
results.creator_credit: Jerry A Callner and Barr Films
results.brief_description: Tells the story of an elderly woman and her young helper who enjoy working together at the flea market, until a stranger makes a remarkable offer to buy and care for the woman. Focuses on the needs and feelings of the elderly in modern society.

results.title: The Antipodeans (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Brian Adams and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Landscape with figures: the art of Australia”.
One of a series in which Robert Hughes surveys Australia’s art from the time of the first fleet to the present day. Arthur Boyd and John Perceval had progressed through the ‘angry decade’ and younger painters joined them: Robert Dickerson, Charles Blackman, John Brack, Clifton Pugh and David Boyd, and two greats who were to influence the future, Sidney Nolan and Leonard French.

results.title: The Antipodean painters : seven contemporary Australian
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Patrick Ryan and Eltham Films
results.brief_description: In 1959 a group of Australian artists banded together and called themselves the Antipodeans. They were opposed to non-figurative painting and re-asserted the need for recognisable images and the importance of subject mattter and feeling. The artists involved, Arthur Boyd, David Boyd, John Perceval, Charles Blackman, Robert Dickerson, John Brack and Clifton Pugh have their work surveyed in this film which examines the themes explored by the ‘antipodeans’ with illustrations of their works. Early documentary by Australian feature film director Tim Burstall.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tim Burstall, Patrick Ryan and Eltham Films

results.title: The Anti-hero [study extract]
results.brief_description: Excerpt from British film “The Loneliness of the Long Distance Runner” in which six young men are incarcerated in a correctional institution for male offenders called Ruxton Towers. The prisoners are encouraged to conform, with emphasis placed on discipline and team work through sports. One lad who is groomed by the Governor for possible olympic stardom ends up showing his contempt for authority by sabotaguing Ruxton Towers chance at victory in an inter-prison cross country competition.

results.title: The Ant and the grasshopper
results.brief_description: This animated fable points out the familiar moral that we can’t play all the time but must work and save for a time of need. While all the ants labor industriously to provide for the coming winter, the grasshopper rests in the summer sun. But when winter comest, the grasshopper finds it difficult to live and it is the ants turn to sing and play. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: The Ant and the dove
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Gakken Company
results.brief_description: One good turn deserves another is the moral of this fable by Aesop. This charming tale of an ant who, despite his small size, is able to save the life of his friend, the dove, will stimulate and delight young children.
